doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF, EXERCISE OPTION,MANUSCRIPT DEVELOPMENT FOR LOGGERHEAD SEA TURTLE DENSITY PROJECT
OBLIGATE FUNDS FOR PROPOSAL PREPARATION OF P00018

MOST OF THE BUILD-UP OF STELLAR AND BLACK HOLE MASS IN THE UNIVERSE OCCURS ~2-10 BILLION YEARS AFTER THE BIG BANG IN DUSTY, GAS-RICH GALAXIES. STUDYING THE PHYSICAL PROPERTIES OF THESE GALAXIES IS NON-TRIVIAL AS MOST OF THE LIGHT FROM STARS OR ACCRETION ONTO SUPERMASSIVE BLACK HOLES (I.E. AGN) IS ABSORBED BY DUST AND RE-EMITTED IN THE INFRARED. THE EXACT SHAPE OF THE INFRARED SPECTRAL ENERGY DISTRIBUTION (SED) PROVIDES CLUES AS TO THE RELATIVE ROLES OF STAR-FORMATION AND AGN, AS WELL AS THE GEOMETRIC DISTRIBUTION OF THE DUST (I.E. IS IT A COMPACT POST-MERGER SOURCE OR AN EXTENDED DISK SIMILAR TO THE MILKY WAY). UNDERSTANDING HOW THE INFRARED SEDS EVOLVE WITH REDSHIFT AND LUMINOSITY (POWER OUTPUT) ACROSS THIS KEY EPOCH IN GALAXY FORMATION LEADS TO AN UNDERSTANDING OF HOW SUPERMASSIVE BLACK HOLES AND THEIR HOST GALAXIES CO-EVOLVED, AND ULTIMATELY HOW AND WHEN THE STARS WE OBSERVE IN THE LOCAL UNIVERSE WERE FORMED. OUR KEY OBJECTIVES ARE: OBJECTIVE 1: CONSTRAIN THE REDSHIFT AND LUMINOSITY EVOLUTION OF IR SEDS- WE WILL USE AN UNPRECEDENTED SAMPLE OF 342 GALAXIES WITH VARYING LEVELS OF STAR FORMATION AND BLACK HOLE ACTIVITY COVERING THE PEAK EPOCH OF STAR-FORMATION AND BLACK HOLE BUILD-UP. OUR SAMPLE IS IDEALLY SUITED TO THE PURPOSE WITH EXCELLENT COVERAGE ACROSS THE INFRARED SPECTRUM IN PARTICULAR INCLUDING MID-IR SPECTRA WHICH ARE CRUCIAL FOR AGN STRENGTH DIAGNOSTICS. WE WILL ALSO PRODUCE AN SED TEMPLATE LIBRARY DEFINED IN DIFFERENT BINS OF REDSHIFT AND LUMINOSITY. OBJECTIVE 2: CONSTRAIN THE ROLE OF AGNWE WILL COMPARE SEVERAL OBSERVED DIAGNOSTICS OF THE PRESENCE AND STRENGTH OF AN AGN, INCLUDING MID-IR SPECTRAL DIAGNOSTICS, SED MODEL-FITTING, AND X-RAY LUMINOSITY. WE WILL ALSO USE STATE-OF-THE-ART MERGER AND ISOLATED GALAXY SIMULATIONS, WHICH PREDICT OBSERVED SEDS AS A FUNCTION OF TIME AND FOR A WIDE RANGE OF UNDERLYING PHYSICAL CONDITIONS (INCLUDING THE STRENGTH OF THE AGN). THIS COMPARISON IS ESPECIALLY IMPORTANT, AS OUR PRELIMINARY WORK INDICATES, THE AGN STRENGTH IN SUCH HEAVILY DUST-OBSCURED GALAXIES TENDS TO BE UNDERESTIMATED BY PURELY OBSERVATIONS-BASED AGN DIAGNOSTICS. OBJECTIVE 3: UNDERSTANDING OBSERVED GALAXIES SELECTION EFFECTS-ALL OBSERVED GALAXY POPULATIONS ARE SUBJECT TO SELECTION BIASES. TO UNDERSTAND THE DUSTY GALAXY POPULATION AS A WHOLE, WE NEED TO LOOK AT A VARIETY OF POPULATIONS SELECTED IN DIFFERENT PARTS OF THE IR SPECTRUM. STARTING WITH THE SED TEMPLATE LIBRARY DERIVED AS PART OF THIS PROJECT, WE WILL SIMULATE THE SELECTION OF DIFFERENT IR-BRIGHT POPULATIONS. WE WILL DO SO THROUGH AN EMPIRICAL GALAXY EVOLUTION MODELING CODE ALREADY IN DEVELOPMENT AT TUFTS UNIVERSITY. THE POPULATIONS WE ARE ESPECIALLY KEEN TO MODEL ARE THE FAR-IR SELECTED HERSCHEL SPACE TELESOPE SOURCES AS WELL AS THE MID-IR SELECTED WIDE-FIELD INFRARED SURVEY (WISE) SOURCES. THE NASA ASTROPHYSICS DATA ANALYSIS PROGRAM AIMS TO SUPPORT VALUE ADDED SCIENCE BASED ON NASA MISSIONS DATA ALREADY IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN. OUR PROPOSAL FITS VERY WELL IN THIS GOAL IN THAT IT NOT ONLY IS BASED ON DATA FROM NASA'S SPITZER AND HERSCHEL INFRARED SPACE TELESCOPES, BUT IT WILL LEAD TO AN IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF THE POPULATIONS SELECTED BY ALL NASA SUPPORTED IR MISSIONS (E.G. IRAS, WISE) AND AN UNDERSTANDING OF HOW THESE POPULATIONS ARE RELATED.

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF REROUTE VOICE AND DATA CABLES; ADD'L OUTLETS, MEPS BOSTON BARNES BLDG, BOSTON MASS

SAX J1810.8-2609 IS A NEUTRON STAR LMXB TRANSIENT WITH A VERY LOW QUIESCENT LUMINOSITY. IT IS ONE OF ONLY THREE NON-PULSARS WITH EVIDENCE FOR ONLY WEAK THERMAL QUIESCENT EMISSION, MAKING IT A PRIME SOURCE TO TEST QUIESCENT EMISSION THEORIES. ITS QUIESCENT EMISSION IS CONSISTENT WITH A PURE POWER-LAW SPECTRUM AND DOES NOT REQUIRE A SOFT (THERMAL) COMPONENT, YET QUIESCENT NEUTRON STAR LMXBS ARE EXPECTED TO HAVE THERMAL EMISSION ASSOCIATED WITH AN ACCRETION-HEATED SURFACE. THE LACK OF A THERMAL COMPONENT WOULD REQUIRE THE NEUTRON STAR TO BE COOLER THAN CAN BE EXPLAINED BY CURRENT HEATING AND COOLING MODELS AND MIGHT REQUIRE THE DESIGNATION OF A NEW SUBCLASS OF POWER-LAW-ONLY QUIESCENT TRANSIENTS. WE PROPOSE TO MAKE A DEEP SEARCH FOR THERMAL EMISSION FROM SAX J1810.8-2609.

doc.ContractDescription: TASK ORDER TITLE: ENERGY STAR FACTS AND INDICATORS TRACKING THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK ORDER IS TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES AND IMPLEMENT PROJECTS TO MEASURE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF PRODUCT, PARTNER, AND/OR PROGRAM-SPECIFIC INITIATIVES EXECUTED IN SUPPORT OF THE ENERGY STAR. SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE: NATIONAL ANALYSIS OF THE CONSORTIUM FOR ENERGY EFFICIENCY (CEE) HOUSEHOLD SURVEY DATASET TO ANALYZE THIS DATASET ON A NATIONAL BASIS AND COMPILE A REPORT ON KEY FINDINGS; DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT A DETAILED RETAIL STORE LEVEL (RSL) ASSESSMENT THAT ASSESSES THE ACCURACY OF ENERGY STAR QUALIFIED PRODUCT LABELING IN STORES; FOR THE CREATION/COMPILATION, REVIEW, AND DOCUMENTATION OF KEY PROGRAM FACTS AND A COMPILATION OF CONSUMER TIPS TO BE USED TO COMMUNICATE INFORMATION TO THE CONSUMERS, THE MEDIA, AND OTHER INTERESTED STAKEHOLDERS ON THE BENEFITS OF ENERGY STAR QUALIFYING PRODUCTS; AND FOR ESTIMATING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE ENERGY STAR PRODUCTS PROGRAM IN MEETING ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND RELATED ENVIRONMENTAL GOALS BY USING THE E-CAST PLATFORM WHICH WAS ADAPTED FROM A NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED PLATFORM FOR ESTIMATING ENERGY SAVINGS. THE PURPOSE OF MODIFICATION NO. 4 IS TO MAKE AN ADMINISTRATIVE CORRECTION TO THE TASK ORDER TITLE OF THE SUBJECT ORDER. IGF::OT::IGF

doc.ContractDescription: THE IONOSPHERE OF MARS IS A PARTIALLY-IONIZED ATMOSPHERE WITH THE ELECTRON DENSITY AT THE PEAK BEING LESS THAN ONE-MILLIONTH THE NEUTRAL DENSITY. SUCH A SITUATION RESULTS IN THE IONOSPHERE BEING A HIGHLY SENSITIVE SYSTEM RESPONSE FUNCTION TO THE BROAD SPECTRUM OF PHYSICAL PROCESSES THAT CREATE, MODIFY OR REMOVE PLASMA. THESE INCLUDE, IN THEIR MOST GENERAL TERMS, SOLAR-PRODUCTION, CHEMICAL LOSS AND A HOST OF DYNAMICAL MECHANISMS ( PLASMA DIFFUSION, NEUTRAL WIND-INDUCED MOTIONS, AND SOLAR WIND CAPTURE). TO STUDY SUCH EFFECTS USING A SYSTEMS APPROACH HAS NEVER BEEN DONE AT MARS AND MAVEN OBSERVATIONS WILL ALLOW THAT FOR THE FIRST TIME. I HAVE BEEN WORKING ON THE CREATION OF THE FIRST MARS INTERNATIONAL REFERENCE IONOSPHERE (MIRI) SINCE I WAS ASKED TO ADDRESS THAT TOPIC BY A COSPAR WORKING GROUP (MENDILLO ET AL 2004). THIS PROPOSAL DEALS WITH THE USE OF THE PRELIMINARY (UNPUBLISHED) VERSION OF MIRI TO HELP INTERPRET THE FLOW OF MAVEN DATA, AND THEN TO USE MAVEN OBSERVATIONS AS A NEW DATA SOURCE FOR ADVANCING MIRI. MIRI IS A PROJECT CONDUCTED USING UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS VIA RESEARCH INTERNSHIP PROGRAMS AT BOSTON UNIVERSITY, SUPPLEMENTED BY THE OVERSIGHT AND YEAR-TO-YEAR CONTINUITY PROVIDED BY A JUNIOR RESEARCH STAFF MEMBER (MS. CLARA NARVAEZ) IN OUR CENTER FOR SPACE PHYSICS. FOR A GLOBAL MODEL, ONE NEEDS GLOBAL DATA SETS AND THE ONLY ONES APPROACHING THAT COME FROM THE MARS EXPRESS (MEX) MISSION. I HAVE FORMED COLLABORATIONS WITH THE TWO SEPARATE TEAMS THAT COMPRISE THE MARS ADVANCED RADAR FOR SUBSURFACE AND IONOSPHERIC SOUNDING (MARSIS). THE MARSIS ACTIVE IONOSPHERIC SOUNDER (AIS) MODE (GURNETT ET AL 2005) USES RADIO SIGNAL REFLECTIONS TO DETERMINE THE PLASMA FREQUENCIES FOR THE PORTION OF NE(H) PROFILES BETWEEN THE PEAK ELECTRON DENSITY (NMAX) AND THE SATELLITE HEIGHT. WE HAVE WORKED WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF IOWAS TEAM ARCHIVE OF 112,000 NMAX VALUES SPANNING THE YEARS 2005-2012 (PROVIDED BY DRS. GURNETT AND MORGAN). THE SUBSURFACE SOUNDER (SS) MODE IS AN IONOSPHERIC-PENETRATING RADAR (SAFAEINILI ET AL 2003; PICARDI ET AL 2005; MOUGINOT ET AL 2008;) THAT MEASURES RADIOWAVE GROUP PATH DELAY AND THUS THE INTEGRAL OF NE(H), CALLED THE TOTAL ELECTRON CONTENT (TEC). THE INITIAL SET OF MARSIS OBSERVATIONS YIELDED APPROXIMATELY 1.4 MILLION TEC VALUES OVER THE COURSE OF A FULL MARTIAN ORBIT (2005-2007). OUR MARSIS/SS COLLABORATION IS WITH DRS. KOFMAN AND MOUGINOT FROM GENOBLE. IN THIS PROPOSAL, I SHOW HOW WE HAVE USED THESE VAST DATA SETS TO CREATE A FIRST-GENERATION EMPIRICAL MODEL FOR MARS IONOSPHERE. IN ADDITION TO ABSOLUTE VALUES, THE CRUCIAL TOPIC OF VARIABILITY IS ADDRESSED AS A FUNCTION OF SOLAR CONDITIONS, ORBITAL LOCATIONS (SEASONS), DAY-VERSUS-NIGHT, AND MORPHOLOGY OF THE MARTIAN CRUSTAL MAGNETIC FIELDS. DIFFERENT WAYS TO CHARACTERIZE VARIABILITY WERE STUDIED, USING STANDARD DEVIATIONS () OF A DATA BIN MEAN VS. DEPARTURES () FROM A CONTROL CURVE. THE PROGRAM SUGGESTED IS TO MAKE THIS MODEL AVAILABLE TO ALL MAVEN PI TEAMS, TO WORK WITH THEM ON HOW TO INTERPRET INITIAL OBSERVATIONS WITHIN THE CONTEXTS OF KNOWN MAGNITUDES AND VARIABILITY, AND TO ADVANCE MAVEN MISSION PLANS AND GOALS IN A TIMELY FASHION. THEN, WHEN ALL MAVEN DATA SETS ARE FULLY ANALYZED, TO USE THESE AERONOMY SYSTEM RESPONSES TO CREATE JOINTLY THE SECOND GENERATION MIRI.

doc.ContractDescription: ELECTRICALLY DRIVEN FLOWS CAN PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT ENHANCEMENTS TO CURRENT AND FUTURE TECHNOLOGIES THAT CAN BENEFIT FROM INCREASED HEAT TRANSFER AND MASS TRANSPORT CAPACITIES IN MACRO AND MICRO SCALES. IN PARTICULAR, ELECTRICALLY GENERATED FLOWS (WITH AND WITHOUT PHASE CHANGE) HAVE GREAT POTENTIAL FOR TERRESTRIAL AND MICRO-GRAVITY APPLICATIONS. ELECTROHYDRODYNAMIC (EHD) ION-DRAGGING PUMPING AND INDUCTION PUMPING HAVE BEEN EXTENSIVELY STUDIED IN THE PAST SEVERAL DECADES WITH NO SIGNIFICANT, SUCCESSFUL APPLICATIONS. ON THE CONTRARY EDH PUMPING BASED ON CONDUCTION PHENOMENON HAS REACHED A STAGE WHERE VARIOUS APPLICATIONS ARE EXPECTED IN THE NEAR FUTURE, SINCE PRESSURE HEADS ON THE ORDER OF KILO PASCAL PER ELECTRODE PAIR ARE EASILY OBTAINABLE. EHD CONDUCTION PUMPS ARE SIMPLE IN DESIGN, LIGHTWEIGHT NON-MECHANICAL, AND FREE OF VIBRATION AND NOISE AND THEY ALLOW FOR ACTIVE CONTROL OF HEAT TRANSFER AND MASS TRANSPORT. EHD CONDUCTION PUMPING REQUIRES MINIMAL ELECTRIC POWER TO OPERATE (AT LEAST THREE ORDERS OF MAGNITUDE LESS: POWER COMPARED TO THE RESULTANT HEAT TRANSPORT CAPACITY). THIS PROPOSED RESEARCH WILL FUNDAMENTALLY INVESTIGATE THE ELECTRICALLY-DRIVEN DIELECTRIC LIQUID FILM IN THE PRESENCE OF PHASE CHANGE IN MACRO- AND MICRO-SCALES BASED ON CONDUCTION PHENOMENON THROUGH A COMBINED EXPERIMENTAL AND COMPUTATIONAL INVESTIGATION. FURTHERMORE THE COUPLING OF ELECTRIC DOUBLE LAYERS AND HETEROCHARGE LAYERS, IN MICRO-CHANNELS WILL BE EXPLORED, AND THE NON-DIMENSIONAL THRESHOLD AT WHICH THE DOUBLE LAYER STARTS TO AFFECT THE CORRESPONDING FLOW FIELD WIN BE DETERMINED. NOTE THAT IN MICRO-SCALES THE DEBYE LENGTH WITHIN DIELECTRIC FLUIDS BECOMES COMPARABLE TO THE CONDUIT DIMENSIONS. ADDITIONALLY, UNIQUE TWO-PHASE HEAT TRANSPORT DEVICES WILL BE DEVELOPED THAT WILL OPERATE BASED ON THE CONDUCTION PHENOMENON, WITH OR WITHOUT CAPILLARY EFFECTS IN MACRO AND MICRO-SCALES. HEAT FLUX LEVELS WITH THESE ACTIVE MICRO-SCALE HEAT TRANSPORT DEVICES ARE EXPECTED TO SIGNIFICANTLY EXCEED THE CORRESPONDING WORKING FLUID CRITICAL HEAT FLUX LEVEL WHILE OPERATING STABLY AND FOR EXAMPLE REACHING MUCH ABOVE 300 W/CM2 FOR REFRIGERANT R-123.

doc.ContractDescription: OBSERVING THE COOLING OF NEUTRON STARS REHEATED BY ACCRETION PROVIDES UNIQUE INSIGHTS INTO NEUTRON-STAR STRUCTURE. HERE WE PROPOSE TO CONTINUE OUR OBSERVATIONS OF THE COOLING NEUTRON STAR IN MAXIJ0556-332, A TRANSIENT THAT HAD BEEN ACCRETING AT NEAR/SUPER-EDDINGTON RATES FOR 16 MONTHS WHEN IT RETURNED TO QUIESCENCE IN MAY 2012. XMM- NEWTON AND CHANDRA OBSERVATIONS IN QUIESCENCE HAVE REVEALED A RAPIDLY COOLING NEUTRON STAR WITH BY FAR THE HIGHEST TEMPERATURES OBSERVED TO DATE FOR SUCH SYSTEMS. WE REQUEST AN 80 KS XMM-NEWTON OBSERVATION OF MAXIJ0556-332 TO INVESTIGATE IF THE CURRENT RAPID COOLING STARTS EVOLVING INTO A TEMPERATURE PLATEAU. KNOWING WHEN AND AT WHAT TEMPERATURE THIS OCCURS WILL HELP US IN UNDERSTANDING THE PROPERTIES OF THE NEUTRON-STAR CRUST, AS WE START PROBING ITS DEEPER LAYERS.
doc.MajorAgency: COOLING OF THE SUPER-HEATED NEUTRON STAR IN MAXI J

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF SMALL BUSINESS SET-ASIDE, 63 OFFERS PLACE OF PERFORMANCE: VENDOR SITE FABRICATION OF COMMERCIAL SERVICES AND SUPPLIES FOR GODDARD SPACE FLIGHT CENTER THE ADVANCED MANUFACTURING BRANCH (AMB) IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTAINING A COMPLETE MANUFACTURING FACILITY TO MEET THE CENTER'S RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT REQUIREMENTS AND ASSIST IN THE FABRICATION OF HARDWARE REQUIREMENTS FROM MULTIPLE NASA PROJECT MISSIONS. THIS FACILITY INCLUDES CONVENTIONAL MACHINING EQUIPMENT, NUMERICALLY CONTROLLED (NC) MACHINING CENTERS, SHEET METAL AND WELDING FABRICATION EQUIPMENT AND REMOTELY LOCATED STAFF SHOPS. VENDORS SHALL PROVIDE FABRICATION SERVICES AND SUPPLIES TO THE MANUFACTURING ENGINEERING GROUP IN THEIR RESPECTIVE AREAS OF EXPERTISE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF INSTRUMENTS AND SPACE FLIGHT AND NON-SPACEFLIGHT HARDWARE INTERCHANGEABLE PIECE PARTS. VENDORS WILL MANUFACTURE PER ENGINEERING DRAWINGS WITH AEROSPACE INDUSTRY TOLERANCES AND PROVIDE FABRICATION CAPABILITIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF WORK. TO FABRICATE CLOSE TOLERANCE AEROSPACE INSTRUMENTS AND SPACE FLIGHT GRADE PARTS, IN VARIOUS MATERIALS SUCH AS (BUT NOT LIMITED TO) ALUMINUM, TITANIUM, HIGH STRENGTH STEEL AND NICKEL ALLOY, ENGINEERING PLASTICS, AND COMPOSITES BASED ON INDUSTRY ENGINEERING DRAWINGS, PROVIDED IN ELECTRONIC FORMAT, TO INDUSTRY STANDARD TOLERANCES AND SPECIFICATIONS. PARTS MAY RANGE IN COMPLEXITY FROM VERY SIMPLE TO VERY COMPLEX, WITH QUANTITIES. EACH DISCIPLINE IS FURTHER DIVIDED INTO SUBCATEGORIES BASED ON THE EXPECTED SIZE OF FABRICATED PARTS. THE FABRICATIONS OF PRODUCTS OR SERVICES PROPOSED AS "SPACEFLIGHT" ARE REQUIRED TO BE, ISO 900I OR AS9100 COMPLAINT, ITEMS PROPOSED AS "NON-FLIGHT" WILL NOT REQUIRE RESPONDENTS TO BE ISO 9001 OR AS9100 COMPLIANT. OFFERS SHALL INDICATE IF THEY ARE ISO 9001 OR AS9100 COMPLAINT AND PROVIDE SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION.
